abstract: Delays continue in attempts to close DC General Family Shelter in Washington, DC, homeless shelter that few deem livable; as many as 270 families live in decrepit former city-run hospital; city is one of few around country promising to shelter families with minor children.

headline.print_headline: Delays Persist  in Shuttering  Shelter That Few  Consider Livable
headline.main: Delays Persist in Shuttering D.C. Homeless Shelter That Few Consider Livable

snippet: City officials proposed a plan six months ago to close the center, but objections to the cost and to possible replacement sites are threatening to derail it....
lead_paragraph: City officials proposed a plan six months ago to close the center, but objections to the cost and to possible replacement sites are threatening to derail it.
